children: A 21-year-old woman is evaluated for the acute onset of painful genital and perianal lesions. HIV
Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

The most likely diagnosis is herpes simplex virus infection. Classically, herpes simplex virus type 2 infection can cause genital herpes and usually presents as a cluster of painful, pink papules that rapidly become vesicular. In immunosuppressed patients, such as those with HIV infection, the presentation may be atypical and may include features such as nodules or nonhealing ulcers, as seen in this patient.
